DataElement.preferredName: Axillary Sentinel Lymph Node Longest Metastatic Diameter Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Value documenting the size of the largest metastatic lymph node diameter within a specimen taken from axillary or sentinel lymph nodes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Axillary Sentinel Lymph Node Longest Metastatic Diameter
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Reference to the largest metastatic lymph node site of a specimen, within axillary and sentinel lymph nodes.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Axillary Node Sentinel Node Lymph Node
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Lymph nodes found in the armpit that drain the lymph channels from the breast.:The first lymph node to which cancer is likely to spread from the primary tumor. Cancer cells may appear first in the sentinel node before spreading to other lymph nodes.:A rounded mass of lymphatic tissue that is surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue. Lymph glands filter lymph (lymphatic fluid), and they store lymphocytes (white blood cells). They are located along lymphatic vessels. Also called a lymph node.

Concepts.definition: One of approximately 20-30 lymph nodes in chain formation that traverse the concavity of the underarm to the clavicle.

The first lymph node that is affected by cancer spread from the primary site.  Sentinel lymph node biopsy is part of the staging work-up to determine early metastasis to regional lymph nodes in patients with breast carcinoma or melanoma.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.:(MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another.:Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference.

Concepts.definition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.
A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's anatomic organs.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the longest diameter of a lymph node.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's anatomic organs.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement
